Description: Rim sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery Siana cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: black at rim, above single brown dilute band; below, ivy wreath band.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd belongs to the same vase as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.376.
Bibliographic references: Brijder 1983 / Siana Cups 1 (p. 199, fig. 68a, p. 262, no. 280)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 230, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0388) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
